intro: Cacalia penicillata, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale purple flowers. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often have a hairy texture. Cacalia penicillata typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
